title: Drawing, ca. 1590
medium: Pen and  bistre ink, brush and wash on paper
inscribed:
Struck out and written below fighting Romans in left foreground:  "aba alcuni morti / Romani."  Written under the elephant is:  "E lilfante magiore;" under the trunk: "che sia togliata / el nifalo."  
In left background under group is: "Vestita acchi / a vesti lungho."  
Struck out below soldiers in right background: "tutti soldati morti / per terra sino a/[girano]."  Reverse: "Annibale fece combattere tra loro parecchi Romani prigioni [prigioneri] campoune/uno e lo fece gettar vine a un liofante prometten-/doli se l'ammazzano lasciano andar libro il Romano ammazza li elefante a solo a solo, ma fu fatto morire da / chavalleri da Annibale lbo 8 cap. 7 plinie."
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: A group of fighting Romans is in the left foreground; three standing see a lying one.  At right is the battle of the elephant with the soldier.    A trunk is roughly outlined below.  In the left background is a box in which Hannibal is seated surrounded by standing persons.  In the right background are fighting soldiers at the beginning of a street.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ca. 1590.
ca. 1590. Pen and  bistre ink, brush and wash on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-158.
